newsitem.title: ESTONIA: ESTONIA-HANSA SAYS SELLS LONG-TERM BUY OPTIONS.
newsitem.headline: ESTONIA-HANSA SAYS SELLS LONG-TERM BUY OPTIONS.

text.p: Hansapank said its options trading was quieter this week with volumes at between 5 to 10 million kroons with short-term options on both the buy and sell side while long-term options trade was on the buy-side.
"Short-term options, maturing on Friday May 16, have both buy and sell calls but the long term is buys," Tonis Haavel, Hansapank options trader, told Reuters.

"Long-term, which is October 97 at present, is buy calls, because people have seen the rise over the the last six months," he added. Haavel said the recent fall on the Tallinn stock exchange appeared to have stopped.
"The market believes that it has reached the bottom and it is not so interested in selling."
The maturity date for options is the third Friday of each month with the next maturity due on May 16.
Hansapank has been trading options since November 1996 with the highest volumes reached around 40-50 million kroons a week.
"Most of the interest in options is spectulative with about two percent using them for hedging," Haavel added.
